info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:13PM EDT until August 04 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON...NORTHEASTERN MORGAN AND NORTHWESTERN BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 313 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Berkeley Springs, or near Hancock, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Clear Spring, Pecktonville, Big Pool, Johnsons Mill, Cherry Run, Spohrs Crossroads, New Hope, Spruce Pine Hollow, Sleepy Creek and Shady Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
